Message.Issue: Consider merging the types defined in 'Registry.Reporting.RegistryReporters' with another namespace.

'ReporterFactory.CreateReporter(ReporterType)' is coupled with 31 different types from 6 different namespaces. Rewrite or refactor the method to decrease its class coupling, or consider moving the method to one of the other types it is tightly coupled with. A class coupling above 40 indicates poor maintainability, a class coupling between 40 and 30 indicates moderate maintainability, and a class coupling below 30 indicates good maintainability.
'ReporterFactory.CreateReporter(ReporterType)' has a cyclomatic complexity of 28. Rewrite or refactor the method to reduce complexity to 25.
If the name 'TenancyContractTypes' is plural, change it to its singular form.
'TenancyStatisticFilterForm.GetFilter()' has a cyclomatic complexity of 28. Rewrite or refactor the method to reduce complexity to 25.

Rule.Name: Avoid excessive class coupling
Rule.Description: Types and methods with a high degree of class coupling can be difficult to maintain.
Rule.Resolution: {0} is coupled with {1} different types from {2} different namespaces. Rewrite or refactor the method to decrease its class coupling, or consider moving the method to one of the other types it is tightly coupled with. A class coupling above {3} indicates poor maintainability, a class coupling between {3} and {4} indicates moderate maintainability, and a class coupling below {4} indicates good maintainability.

Rule.Name: Avoid excessive complexity
Rule.Description: Method implementations that are exceedingly complex increase the challenge of understanding and maintaining code.
Rule.Resolution: {0} has a cyclomatic complexity of {1}. Rewrite or refactor the method to reduce complexity to {2}.

Rule.Name: Avoid namespaces with few types
Rule.Description: A namespace should generally have more than five types.
Rule.Resolution: Consider merging the types defined in '{0}' with another namespace.

Rule.Name: Only FlagsAttribute enums should have plural names
Rule.Description: Plural names indicate that the values of the enumeration can be combined. For example, an enumeration named 'Day' indicates a single day, and an enumeration named 'Days' indicates multiple days. Enumeration values should be combined using the bit-wise OR operator only if the Flags attribute is present on the enumeration.
Rule.Resolution: If the name {0} is plural, change it to its singular form.
